io.jeo.sql

Class DbOP<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.jeo.sql.DbOP<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of object returned by the operation.

    public abstract class DbOP<T>
extends Object
    A database operation.

    Subclasses must implement the doRun(Connection) method. Subclasses are encouraged to use the open(Object) when obtaining resources such as statements and result sets. Upon completion all resources passed to open will be closed in reverse order.

    Example usage: 

     DbOp<Long> count = new DbOp<Long>() {
   protected Long doRun(Connection cx) {
     ResultSet rs = open(open(cx.createStatement()).executeQuery("SELECT count(*) FROM foo"));
     rs.next();
     return rs.getLong(1);
   }
 };

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, OpenGeo

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public final T run(DataSource db)
            throws IOException
        Runs the db operation obtaining a new connection from the specified data source.

        The obtained connection will be closed upon completion.

        Parameters:
        db - The data source to obtain a new connection from.
        Returns:
        The result of the operation.
        Throws:
        IOException - Any errors, including SQLExceptions, that occur.

      • run

        public final T run(Connection cx)
            throws IOException
        Runs the db operation with the specified connection.

        It is the responsibility of the caller to close the specified connection.

        Parameters:
        cx - The db connection.
        Returns:
        The result of the operation.
        Throws:
        IOException - Any errors, including SQLExceptions, that occur.

        protected <T> T open(T obj)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
